author: R Vimal Kumar
text:
Crafts made of brass that even find market abroad, khadi dresses, edible items made from organic crops, butter and detergents, were among the various items made by traditional artisans that are on display at an exhibition at Padmini Gardens here.

The exhibition, organised by Khadi and Village Industries Commission and Tamil Nadu Sarvodaya Sangh to provide a common platform for widening the market reach of products made by artisans affiliated to Sarvodaya Sanghs across the State, will conclude on February 21.

We have even arranged a fashion show on February 14 from 6.30 p.m. to showcase the innovative dress materials made of khadi.

The exhibition is open to visitors on all days from 10.30 a.m. to 9 p.m., said S. A. Aramvalarthan, Assistant Development Officer of KVIC.

One of the main attraction in the exhibition is the lamps and deities crafted by artisans affiliated to Tanjavur West Sarvodaya Sangh.The lamps and deities produced by them generate an annual turnover of Rs. 2 crore, according to N. Sivakumar, the assistant manager of the Sangh. We are exporting them to various countries, including Malaysia, he added. Hand-made silk saris from the Chengelpet Sarvodaya Sangh, ghee and butter by Uthukuli Sarvodaya Sangh, and shirts, honey, detergents from Sarvodaya Sanghs from across the State, are attracting the visitors.
title: Traditional crafts on display
